Literature Review: Cannabidiol (CBD), a non-physchotropic phytocannabinoid derived from Cannabis sativa L., has gained significant attention as a potential therapeutic agent for various health conditions in companion animals, particularly dogs and cats. This literature review aims to summarize the current scientific evidence on the mechanisms of action, pharmacokinetics, safety, regulatory aspects, and efficacy of CBD in managing diseases in dogs and cats.
